abstract: Q&A; Apple contends in court filing that computer code is form of speech, so opening San Bernardino gunman's iPhone would violate firm's First Amendment rights; addressing legal status of code.
lead_paragraph: The company, in its fight with the F.B.I., is defending its phones on grounds that its code represents free speech, and there is some precedent.

headline.main: Analyzing Apple’s Argument That First Amendment Applies to Its Code
headline.print_headline: Addressing the Legal Status of Code

snippet: The company, in its fight with the F.B.I., is defending its phones on grounds that its code represents free speech, and there is some precedent.
